intro: Tithymalus nicaeensis subsp. stepposus, commonly known as the Balkan tithymalus, is a perennial herb native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as rocky slopes and steppe-like environments. It is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the genus Tithymalus.
